ayas.translation: Nun. By the Pen and what they write:
ayas.transliteration: nūn ۚ wal qalami wa mā yasṭurūn

ayas.translation: by your Lord’s blessing, you are not, crazy,
and yours indeed will be an everlasting reward,
ayas.transliteration: wa inna laka la-ajran ghayra mamnūn

ayas.translation: and indeed you possess a great character.
You will see and they will see,
which one of you is crazy.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِٱلْمُهْتَدِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed your Lord knows best those who stray from His way, and He knows best those who are guided.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bil muhtadīn

ayas.translation: So do not obey the deniers,
who are eager that you should be flexible, so that they [too] may be flexible [towards you].
And do not obey any vile swearer,
scandal-monger, talebearer,
hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,
callous and, on top of that, baseborn
—[who behaves in such a manner only] because he has wealth and children.

ayas.arabic: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’
Soon We shall brand him on his snout.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا بَلَوْنَـٰهُمْ كَمَا بَلَوْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ إِذْ أَقْسَمُوا۟ لَيَصْرِمُنَّهَا مُصْبِحِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed we have tested them just as We tested the People of the Garden when they vowed they would gather its fruit at dawn,
ayas.transliteration: innā balawnāhum kamā balawnā aṣ-ḥābal jannati idh aqsamū layaṣrimunnahā muṣbiḥīn

ayas.translation: and they did not make any exception.

ayas.arabic: فَطَافَ عَلَيْهَا طَآئِفٌ مِّن رَّبِّكَ وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Then, a visitation from your Lord visited it while they were asleep.
ayas.transliteration: faṭāfa `alayhā ṭā-ifun min rabbika wahum nā-imūn

ayas.translation: So, by dawn it was like a harvested field.
At dawn they called out to one another,

ayas.arabic: أَنِ ٱغْدُوا۟ عَلَىٰ حَرْثِكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: ‘Get off early to your field if you have to gather [the fruits].’
So off they went, murmuring to one another:

ayas.arabic: أَن لَّا يَدْخُلَنَّهَا ٱلْيَوْمَ عَلَيْكُم مِّسْكِينٌ
ayas.translation: ‘Today no needy man shall come to you in it.’
And they set out at early morning, [considering themselves] able to deprive [the poor of its fruit].
But when they saw it, they said, ‘We have indeed lost our way!’
‘No, it is we who have been deprived!’

ayas.arabic: قَالَ أَوْسَطُهُمْ أَلَمْ أَقُل لَّكُمْ لَوْلَا تُسَبِّحُونَ
ayas.translation: The most upright among them said, ‘Did I not tell you, ‘‘Why do you not glorify [Allah]?’’ ’
ayas.transliteration: qāla awsaṭuhum alam aqul lakum lawlā tusabbiḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّنَآ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: They said, ‘Immaculate is our Lord! We have indeed been wrongdoers!’
ayas.transliteration: qālū subḥāna rabbinā innā kunnā ẓālimīn

ayas.translation: Then they turned to one another, blaming each other.
They said, ‘Woe to us! Indeed, we have been rebellious.

ayas.arabic: عَسَىٰ رَبُّنَآ أَن يُبْدِلَنَا خَيْرًا مِّنْهَآ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا رَٰغِبُونَ
ayas.translation: Maybe our Lord will give us a better one in its place. Indeed we earnestly beseech our Lord.’
ayas.transliteration: `asā rabbunā an yubdilanā khayran minhā innā ilā rabbinā rāghibūn

ayas.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۖ وَلَعَذَابُ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ أَكْبَرُ ۚ لَوْ كَانُوا۟ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Such was their punishment; and the punishment of the Hereafter is surely greater, had they known.
ayas.transliteration: kadhālikal `adhāb ۖ wala`adhābul-ākhirati akbar ۚ law kānū ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّـٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
ayas.translation: Indeed for the Godwary there will be gardens of bliss near their Lord.
Shall We treat those who submit [to Us] as [We treat] the guilty?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge!
Do you possess a scripture in which you read
that you shall have in it whatever you choose?

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَكُمْ أَيْمَـٰنٌ عَلَيْنَا بَـٰلِغَةٌ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۙ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَمَا تَحْكُمُونَ
ayas.translation: Do you have a pledge binding on Us until the Day of Resurrection, that you shall indeed have whatever you decide?
ayas.transliteration: am lakum aymānun `alaynā bālighatun ilā yawmil qiyāmati inna lakum lamā taḥkumūn

ayas.translation: Ask them, which of them will aver [any of] that!

ayas.arabic: أَمْ لَهُمْ شُرَكَآءُ فَلْيَأْتُوا۟ بِشُرَكَآئِهِمْ إِن كَانُوا۟ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Do they have any ‘partners’ [that they claim for Allah]? Then let them produce their partners, if they are truthful.
ayas.transliteration: am lahum shurakā-u falya-tū bishurakā-ihim in kānū ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: يَوْمَ يُكْشَفُ عَن سَاقٍ وَيُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ
ayas.translation: The day when the catastrophe occurs and they are summoned to prostrate themselves, they will not be able [to do it].
ayas.transliteration: yawma yukshafu `an sāqin wayud`awna ilas sujūdi falā yastaṭī`ūn

ayas.arabic: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تَرْهَقُهُمْ ذِلَّةٌ ۖ وَقَدْ كَانُوا۟ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَى ٱلسُّجُودِ وَهُمْ سَـٰلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: With a humbled look [in their eyes], they will be overcast by abasement. Certainly, they were summoned to prostrate themselves while they were yet sound.
ayas.transliteration: khāshi`atan abṣāruhum tarhaquhum dhillah ۖ waqad kānū yud`awna ilas sujūdi wahum sālimūn

ayas.arabic: فَذَرْنِى وَمَن يُكَذِّبُ بِهَـٰذَا ٱلْحَدِيثِ ۖ سَنَسْتَدْرِجُهُم مِّنْ حَيْثُ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: So leave Me with those who deny this discourse. We will draw them imperceptibly [into ruin], whence they do not know.
ayas.transliteration: fadharnī wa man yukadhhibu bihādhal ḥadīth ۖ sanastadrijuhum min ḥaythu lā ya`lamūn

ayas.translation: I will grant them respite, for My devising is indeed sure.

ayas.arabic: أَمْ تَسْـَٔلُهُمْ أَجْرًا فَهُم مِّن مَّغْرَمٍ مُّثْقَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Do you ask them for a reward, so that they are weighed down with debt?
ayas.transliteration: am tas-aluhum ajran fahum min maghramin muthqalūn

ayas.translation: Do they possess [access to] the Unseen, so that they write it down?

ayas.arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تَكُن كَصَاحِبِ ٱلْحُوتِ إِذْ نَادَىٰ وَهُوَ مَكْظُومٌ
ayas.translation: So submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord, and do not be like the Man of the Fish who called out as he choked with grief.
ayas.transliteration: faṣbir liḥukmi rabbika walā takun kaṣāḥibil ḥūti idh nādā wahuwa makẓūm

ayas.arabic: لَّوْلَآ أَن تَدَٰرَكَهُۥ نِعْمَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ لَنُبِذَ بِٱلْعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ مَذْمُومٌ
ayas.translation: Had it not been for a blessing that came to his rescue from his Lord, he would surely have been cast on the bare shore, being blameworthy.
ayas.transliteration: lawlā an tadārakahu ni`matun min rabbihi lanubidha bil `arā-i wahuwa madhmūm

ayas.translation: So his Lord chose him and made him one of the righteous.

ayas.arabic: وَإِن يَكَادُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَيُزْلِقُونَكَ بِأَبْصَـٰرِهِمْ لَمَّا سَمِعُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَيَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُۥ لَمَجْنُونٌ
ayas.translation: Indeed the faithless almost devour you with their eyes when they hear this Reminder, and they say, ‘He is indeed crazy.’
ayas.transliteration: wa in yakādul ladhīna kafarū layuzliqūnaka bi-abṣārihim lammā sami`udh dhikra wayaqūlūna innahu lamajnūn

ayas.translation: Yet it is just a reminder for all the nations.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā huwa illā dhikrul lil`ālamīn
